name: Rest & Recovery
content:
During the Quest phase of play, members of the Quest may take one Short Rest and one Long Rest per day:

SHORT REST

At least 1 hour of undisturbed rest is considered a SHORT REST. If you are not Helpless, you recover Endurance equal to your BODY score.

LONG REST

At least 6 consecutive hours of undisturbed rest is considered a LONG REST. You recover all of your Endurance. If you’re Helpless, you instead recover Endurance equal to your BODY score. If you have 0 Hope, you regain 1 Hope. If a Long Rest is interrupted by one hour or more of activity, you instead gain the benefits of a short rest.

The Quest’s Standard of Living may improve or reduce the benefits of resting:

INTERMEZZO

An Intermezzo (the time between Quests) is another opportunity to rest and recover from the hardships of the questing life. As described earlier in the The Questing Life section, an Intermezzo is an opportunity to enrich the characters’ connections to the world around them, but it is also an important time for recovering from the hardships of adventuring.

The Intermezzo phase is open-ended and group consensus determines the outcome and effects of characters’ actions, but there are some specific actions characters can take to recover their strength:

DISTRIBUTE FELLOWSHIP POINTS

Any Fellowship Points left over at the end of the previous Quest may be distributed among those who participated in the Quest. Each point distributed in this way removes 1 Shadow or clears 1 condition for the recipient. Players should reach consensus about how to distribute the points.

TREAT INJURIES

For each day spent in the care of a skilled healer, remove 1 Injury.

Depending on the circumstances, the GM may require that you maintain a certain standard of living or spend an amount of treasure to account for the healer’s wages.

STRENGTHEN FELLOWSHIP

If you and another member of the Fellowship spend most or all of the Intermezzo together pursuing a task together, choose one:

  • You each clear 1 Shadow.

  • The Fellowship starts the next Quest with one additional Fellowship Point (as long as at least one of you joins that Quest).

CLEAR CONDITIONS

The requirements for CLEARING CONDITIONS during an Intermezzo are the same as during a Quest, but in some situations it may be wise to deal with those emotions in a more controlled environment than during a Quest. See the Conditions section.
